intro: Aegopodium latifolium, commonly known as broadleaf cow parsley, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes other familiar plants like carrots and parsley. The plant features slender stems with finely divided, fern-like leaves that are often bluish-green in color. It produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in umbrella-like clusters, typical of the carrot family. Broadleaf cow parsley is often found in grassy areas and along roadsides, and it is sometimes used in traditional herbal medicine.
